$regime.title: Tax Regime
$regime.description:
Regime is the country code that identifies the tax regime applicable to the document.
It determines which country-specific tax rules, normalizations, and validations are applied.
If this field is not provided, the supplierâ€™s country code is used as the default regime.

label.title: Label
label.description:
Label can be used to provide a custom label for the party in a given
context in a single language, for example "Supplier", "Host", or similar.

name.title: Name
name.description: Legal name or representation of the organization.

tax_id.title: Tax Identity
tax_id.description: The entity's legal ID code used for tax purposes. They may have other numbers, but we're only interested in those valid for tax purposes.

identities.title: Identities
identities.description: Set of codes used to identify the party in other systems.

people.title: People
people.description: Details of physical people who represent the party.

inboxes.title: Inboxes
inboxes.description: Digital inboxes used for forwarding electronic versions of documents

addresses.title: Postal Addresses
addresses.description: Regular post addresses for where information should be sent if needed.

websites.title: Websites
websites.description: Public websites that provide further information about the party.

registration.title: Registration
registration.description: Additional registration details about the company that may need to be included in a document.

logos.title: Logos
logos.description: Images that can be used to identify the party visually.

ext.title: Extensions
ext.description: Extension code map for any additional regime specific codes that may be required.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Any additional semi-structured information that does not fit into the rest of the party.

Party.description: Party represents a person or business entity.
